intro: Lesquerella shearis, commonly known as the Texas lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds produce a unique oil that has been studied for potential industrial and cosmetic applications. Lesquerella shearis is also of interest for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
